metadata.synopsis: In this dialogue, Lur Xanta is trying to convince the other 3 to leave with her to join the cult of Lolth.Player can help her convince them, or fail to do so and they will attack Lur Xanta for being disloyal.This dialogue has 2 outcomes:AGGRO: Lur Jox (or another spider) attacks Lur Xanta, killing her in one shot. (via gameplay - not cine)PEACEFUL: Lur Xanta convinces the other 3 to follow her into the Underdark-- they are leaving to somewhere new.Lur Xanta is fantatical and somewhat learned. The other 3 are a bit more simple.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. loadlevel WLD_Main_A2. goto -621.967; 1.504; 362.33. Talk to any of the spiders.

119.speaker: Lur Xanta
119.text: I speak true, brothers! You know it in your hearts! You know it in your very souls!

53.speaker: Lur Jox
53.text: We need no 'Lolth' - no spider queen! Father Murmath is the head of clan Lur. He hatched us, raised us, feeds us!

46.speaker: Lur Xanta
46.text: What care we for his business here? He keeps us small. Keeps us contained. We should be with the Spider Queen - revered, adored!

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Your sister speaks true. The Spider Queen would welcome you with great enthusiasm.

94.speaker: Lur Xanta
94.text: You! Please - explain to my brothers - we must be among our own kind!

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *These spiders are loyal to the local duergar. In the event of a fight, they will join the fray against you - with slavering enthusiasm.*

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'd rather not get involved in your little coup.

0.speaker: Lur Xanta
0.text: It is no coup - it is the opportunity of our entire lives!

52.speaker: Lur Jox
52.text: Fie! Xanta - even the Spider Queen's faithful wants no part in your game!

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I suppose the Order of the Soul Spiders would have room for you among their ranks.

129.speaker: Lur Xanta
129.text: I've heard the very same! Come, brothers - follow me into her hairy embrace!

34.speaker: Lur Jox
34.text: We need no 'Order' - Father Murmath is the way!

102.speaker: Lur Xanta
102.text: Fools! Don't you see - the time of Murmath has passed! The Spider Queen awaits us!

86.speaker: Player
86.text: The Spider Queen doesn't suffer hesitation. I fear for anyone who resists her call.

8.speaker: Lur Xanta
8.text: The time for planning is over! Follow me, brothers - into her hairy embrace!

169.speaker: Lur Otan
169.text: He is all he is and all he is not!

71.speaker: Player
71.text: THE PRIEST IS WEAK. BECOME STRONG.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Among the Spider Queen's followers, you'd be revered as her physical manifestation. Honoured. Exalted.

35.speaker: Lur Xanta
35.text: All three! Follow me, brothers - we will find our due among the Spider Queen's dedicants. We deserve as much!

1.speaker: Lur Xanta
1.text: In the name of the Spider Queen - we fly!

50.speaker: Lur Jox
50.text: We owe Father Murmath all we are - and we will never betray him!

64.speaker: Lur Xanta
64.text: But - but the Spider Queen! Lolth! Our due!

78.speaker: Player
78.text: You owe nothing to Murmath. Break your bonds, free yourselves. Become unstoppable.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Recall your learnings about the Spider Queen, Lolth.

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *You've read that harming spiders is illegal among Lolth's faithful - and often punishable by death.*

168.speaker: Lur Xanta
168.text: Father Murmath is our past - Lolth is our future!

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Turning on your head-of-clan, are you? I'm sure that'll end well.

116.speaker: Lur Xanta
116.text: We do not turn on Father Murmath. But we do outgrow him. The fate of clan Lur lies with the Spider Queen!

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You should know that spiders are revered among Lolth's faithful. Harming one of your kind is a capital crime.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Murmath? Is that the guy who keeps telling everyone about his useless, hideous spiders?

83.speaker: Lur Xanta
83.text: He... he might've! He doesn't know our true potential - our true splendour! Only Lolth knows that.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I don't care where you go, but it's time for all of you to leave.

142.speaker: Lur Xanta
142.text: You see?! Such disrespect! Such disdain! And does Father Murmath raise a whisper in our defence? With the Spider Queen's protection, we would never suffer such indignity again!

103.speaker: Lur Xanta
103.text: You see? Father Murmath's time has passed. Come, brothers - follow me into Lolth's hairy embrace!

93.speaker: Lur Jox
93.text: We will not betray Father Murmath. We will never leave him!

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I think your sister is right - among the Spider Queen's worshippers, you'll reach your true potential.

36.speaker: Lur Xanta
36.text: This and so much more. In Lolth's hairy embrace, all is possible.

39.speaker: Lur Xanta
39.text: HAHA! Yes! Now, brothers - our new dawn awaits!

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Spiders for the Spider Queen. Seems logical.

62.speaker: Lur Xanta
62.text: But it goes beyond logic. Do not you feel it, brothers? The pull for something more? Do you not see it, friend visitor? Their unfulfilled potential?

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *You don't sense much unfulfilled potential, but one thing is certain: this crew won't hesitate to sink their fangs into your belly if their duergar master gives the word.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *You sense very little from the shifting trio.*

61.speaker: Player
61.text: See how this mutiny plays out.

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *These spiders aren't wild - they've been raised by local duergar and are fiercely loyal to them.*

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Try to discern the nature of their chatter.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *They appear to be in conflict - the larger spider versus the other three.*

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Hey! Knock it off, the lot of you!

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Stand back and see how things play out.
